thread.title: Julian Edelman one-upped Julio Jones’s insane fourth-quarter Super Bowl catch
thread.title_full: Julian Edelman one-upped Julio Jones’s insane fourth-quarter Super Bowl catch

author: Des Bieler
title: Julian Edelman one-upped Julio Jones’s insane fourth-quarter Super Bowl catch
text:
— Bleacher Report (@BleacherReport) February 6, 2017 
Even Jerry Rice, who holds numerous Super Bowl records, including career receptions (33) and yards (589), yards gained in a single game (215) and total touchdowns (eight), was highly impressed. What a catch by Julio Jones #Unbelievable 
— Jerry Rice (@JerryRice) February 6, 2017 
However, a sack and a holding penalty pushed the Falcons out of field goal range. The Patriots got the ball back, and after they moved from near their own end zone to their 36-yard line, this happened: 
— NFL Network (@nflnetwork) February 6, 2017 Julien Edelman is a freaking magician pic.twitter.com/nNepll2NWl 
— Wheeling Problems (@wheelingprobs) February 6, 2017 THAT IS INCREDIBLE. EDELMAN pic.twitter.com/CHD8JSIPeO 
— Spark Sports (@Spark_Sports_) February 6, 2017 SUPER slow Julian Edelman catch…. pic.twitter.com/mwXVA5v3bB 
— Cole Cubelic (@colecubelic) February 6, 2017 
In the immediate aftermath of that catch, a lot of observers had the same thought: Sorry, Julio, but that was better. Insane, just one upped Julio Jones 
— Big Cat (@BarstoolBigCat) February 6, 2017 Julio Jones makes the catch of the game 
Edelman: hold my beer 
— Chelsa Messinger (@ChelsaMessinger) February 6, 2017 Julio with the catch of the year. Edelman with the new catch of the year. Wow! #SB51 
— Mike Conley (@mconley11) February 6, 2017 
The Patriots were famously victimized by a how-the-heck-did-he-do-that Super Bowl grab in 2008, when David Tyree’s “Helmet Catch” helped his Giants win. Now, even with a host of highlights in which to revel from their team’s decade and a half of dominance, New England fans can look back at Edelman’s effort as one for the ages. 
Falcons fans will be haunted by their squad’s heartbreaking 34-28 loss, but one hopes they can take some solace on Jones’s catch, which could only have been topped in the most improbable way. sports Get the top Olympics news by email Major news and analysis from Rio, delivered to your inbox as it happens. post_newsletter333
